global_attributes.Conventions: Esri conventions as given in 'ESRI Shapefile Technical Description, an ESRI White Paper, July 1998' http://www.esri.com/library/whitepapers/pdfs/shapefile.pdf
global_attributes.title: Level 2 KaRIn High Rate River Tile Node Data Product

reach_id.long_name: reach ID with which node is associated
reach_id.comment: Unique reach identifier from the prior river database. The format of the identifier is CBBBBBRRRRT, where C=continent, B=basin, R=reach, T=type.

node_id.long_name: node ID of the node in the prior river database
node_id.comment: Unique node identifier from the prior river database. The format of the identifier is CBBBBBRRRRNNNT, where C=continent, B=basin, R=reach, N=node, T=type.

time.tai_utc_difference: [value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
time.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the metadata leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.

time_tai.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the TAI time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 TAI. This time scale contains no leap seconds. The difference (in seconds) with time in UTC is given by the metadata [time:tai_utc_difference].

time_str.tai_utc_difference: [value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
time_str.comment: Time string giving UTC time. The format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ, where the Z suffix indicates UTC time.

lat.long_name: latitude of centroid of water-detected pixels
lat.comment: Geodetic latitude of the centroid of water-detected pixels assigned to the node. Positive latitude values increase northward from the equator.

lon.long_name: longitude of centroid of water-detected pixels
lon.comment: Geodetic longitude of the centroid of water-detected pixels assigned to the node. The longitude values become more positive to the east and more negative to the west of the Prime Meridian.

lat_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the latitude of the centroid of water-detected pixels assigned to the node.

lon_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the longitude of the centroid of water-detected pixels assigned to the node.

wse.long_name: water surface elevation with respect to the geoid
wse.comment: Fitted node water surface elevation, relative to the provided model of the geoid (geoid_hght), with all corrections for media delays (wet and dry troposphere, and ionosphere), crossover correction, and tidal effects (solid_tide, load_tidef, and pole_tide) applied.

wse_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the water surface elevation
wse_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the node WSE, including uncertainties of corrections, and variation about the fit.

wse_r_u.long_name: random-only uncertainty in the water surface elevation
wse_r_u.comment: Random-only uncertainty component in the node WSE, including uncertainties of corrections, and variation about the fit.

width_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the node width
width_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the node width.

area_total.long_name: total water surface area including dark water
area_total.comment: Total estimated water surface area, including dark water that was not detected as water in the SWOT observation but identified through the use of a prior water likelihood map.

area_tot_u.long_name: uncertainty in the total water surface area
area_tot_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the total estimated water surface area area_total.

area_detct.long_name: surface area of detected water pixels
area_detct.comment: Surface area of node that was detected as water by the SWOT observation.

area_det_u.long_name: uncertainty in the surface area of detected water
area_det_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the surface area of the detected water pixels.

area_wse.long_name: area used to compute water surface elevation
area_wse.comment: Surface area of the node that contributed to the computation of the WSE.

layovr_val.comment: Value indicating an estimate of the height error due to layover (TBD).

node_dist.long_name: distance between observed and prior river database node location
node_dist.comment: Distance between the observed node location and the node location in the prior river database.

xtrk_dist.long_name: distance to the satellite ground track
xtrk_dist.comment: Distance of the observed node location from the spacecraft nadir track. A negative value indicates the left side of the swath, relative to the spacecraft velocity vector. A positive value indicates the right side of the swath.

flow_angle.long_name: river flow direction relative to the satellite ground track
flow_angle.comment: River flow direction for the node relative to the direction of the spacecraft nadir track based on prior data (not the SWOT observation). A value of zero indicates that the flow is in the same direction as the spacecraft velocity direction. A value of 90 degrees indicates that the flow is toward the right side of the SWOT swath.

node_q.long_name: summary quality indicator for the node
node_q.comment: Summary quality indicator for the node measurement. Values of 0 and 1 indicate nominal and off-nominal measurements.

dark_frac.comment: Fraction of node area_total covered by dark water.

ice_clim_f.comment: Climatological ice cover flag indicating whether the node is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on external climatological information (not the SWOT measurement). Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the node is likely not ice covered, may or may not be partially or fully, and likely fully ice covered, respectively

ice_dyn_f.comment: Dynamic ice cover flag indicating whether the surface is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on analysis of external satellite optical data. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the node is not ice covered, partially ice covered, and fully ice covered, respectively.

partial_f.comment: Flag that indicates only partial node coverage. The flag is 0 if at least 10 pixels have a valid WSE measurement; the flag is 1 otherwise and node-level quantities are not computed.

n_good_pix.long_name: number of pixels that have a valid WSE
n_good_pix.comment: Number of pixels assigned to the node that have a valid node WSE.

rdr_sig0.comment: Median of the sigma0 from the pixel cloud points assigned to the node in determining the node WSE. The value is provided as a linear power ratio, not a value in decibels. A decibel value may be obtained from: rdr_sig0_in_dB = 10*log10(rdr_sig0).

rdr_sig0_u.comment: Uncertainty of sig0. The value is provided in linear units. This value is a one-sigma additive (not multiplicative) uncertainty term, which can be added to or subtracted from rdr_sig0.

rdr_pol.comment: Flag indicating whether the node is observed with a horizontal (H) or vertical (V) signal polarization.

geoid_hght.comment: Geoid height above the reference ellipsoid with a correction to refer the value to the mean tide system i.e., includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).

solid_tide.source: Cartwright and Taylor (1971) and Cartwright and Edden (1973)
solid_tide.comment: Solid-Earth (body) tide height. The zero-frequency permanent tide component is not included.

load_tidef.comment: Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value is used to compute wse.

load_tideg.comment: Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust.

pole_tide.comment: Geocentric pole tide height. The sum total of the contribution from the solid-Earth (body) pole tide height and the load pole tide height (i.e., the effect of the ocean pole tide loading of the Earth's crust).

dry_trop_c.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
dry_trop_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to dry troposphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

wet_trop_c.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
wet_trop_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to wet troposphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

iono_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to ionosphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

xovr_cal_c.comment: Height correction from KaRIn crossover calibration. The correction is applied before geolocation but reported as an equivalent height correction.

p_wse.comment: Node WSE from the prior river database.

p_wse_var.comment: Node WSE spatial variability from the prior river database.

p_width.comment: Node width from prior river database.

p_wid_var.comment: Node width spatial variability from the prior river database.

p_dist_out.long_name: distance from the node to the outlet
p_dist_out.comment: Along-stream distance from the node to the outlet, from the prior river database.

p_length.comment: Length of the node from the prior river database. This value is used to compute the node width from the water surface area.

p_dam_id.comment: Dam ID from the Global Reservoir and Dam (GRanD) database. The value is 0 if there is no influence of dams at the node, and a positive value indicates there is an influence of a dam at the node. The value of grand_id identifies the dam ID in the GRanD database. Nodes influenced by dams are indicated by the type code in node_id.

p_n_ch_max.long_name: maximum number of channels detected in node
p_n_ch_max.comment: Maximum number of channels at the node, from the prior river database.

p_n_ch_mod.long_name: mode of the number of channels at the node
p_n_ch_mod.comment: Mode of the number of channels at the node, from the prior river database.
